page.title: 14A Day in the Life of Alan 2
page.content: We like to play 'had' or 'tally-ho' the best. In 'had' someone is 'it' and they have to chase after you and try to catch you. In 'tally-ho' one group of children stand in line in the playground and someone is 'it'. They pick one of the children in the line. That person has to reach the end of the playground before the person who is 'it' catches them. If they make it, the others from the line run down. If the person is 'hadded' they are 'it' with the first person and another child is picked from the line to be chased. The object of the game is to try to be the last person caught. At 3.30pm we finish school. When I get home I play with my friend, Paul Eddicott. At 9.0pm I go to bed. I read for a while and then go to sleep.
